conclusion: Analyze shadow changes when light source moves based on image and shadow principles
Four objects on a wooden surface: black typewriter, blue alarm clock, brown egg, white battery pack
Shadows labeled as A (alarm clock), B (egg), C (alarm clock), D (battery pack)
Shadows depend on light source angle and distance
Shadow position shifts opposite to light source movement
Shadow size changes with light angle; lower angle stretches shadow
Current light source likely above and slightly front, casting shadows downward and slightly to sides
Assume single primary light source for simplicity
Back left movement shifts shadows to front right
Shadow A moves to bottom right
Shadow B moves to bottom right
Shadow C moves to bottom right, may merge with A
Shadow D moves to bottom right
Back left movement stretches shadows longer and wider
A and C elongate and stretch to front right
B becomes longer and narrower
D elongates and stretches to front right
Back right movement shifts shadows to front left
Shadow A moves to bottom left
Shadow B moves to bottom left
Shadow C moves to bottom left, may align with A
Shadow D moves to bottom left
Back right movement stretches shadows longer and wider
A and C elongate and stretch to front left
B becomes longer and narrower
D elongates and stretches to front left
Alarm clock taller, shadows more pronounced with lower angle
